io.spine.server.storage

Class StorageFactorySwitch

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.storage.StorageFactorySwitch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Supplier<StorageFactory>

    public final class StorageFactorySwitch
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.function.Supplier<StorageFactory>
    The Supplier of StorageFactory that takes into account if the code runs under tests on in the production mode.

    Test mode

    Under tests this class returns InMemoryStorageFactory if a Supplier for tests was not set via StorageFactorySwitch.init(Supplier, Supplier).

    Production mode

    In the production mode this class obtains the instance provided by the Supplier passed via StorageFactorySwitch.init(Supplier, Supplier). If the production Supplier was not initialized, IllegalStateException will be thrown.

    Remembering StorageFactory obtained from suppliers

    In both modes the reference to the StorageFactory obtained from a Supplier will be stored. This means that a call to Supplier.get() method of the suppliers passed via StorageFactorySwitch.init(Supplier, Supplier) will be made only once.
    See Also:
    Environment.isTests()

        public static StorageFactorySwitch newInstance(io.spine.core.BoundedContextName boundedContextName,
                                               boolean multitenant)
        Obtains the instance of the switch that corresponds to multi-tenancy mode.
        Parameters:
        boundedContextName - the name of the bounded context in which this switch works
        multitenant - if true the switch is requested for the multi-tenant execution context, false for the single-tenant context

        Initializes the current singleton instance with the suppliers.
        Parameters:
        productionSupplier - the supplier for the production mode
